title: Log user/resource/timestamp/IP/action/context on resource access
summary: Log each access to resources, including user ID, resource, timestamp, IP address, action, and access context. This enables granular event tracking per access for files, records, or dashboards, supporting compliance and security requirements in regulated SaaS environments.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Log each access event—including user ID, timestamp, IP, access type, and context—for files, records, or dashboards

title: Support 1-year configurable log retention policy
summary: Implement a log retention policy with a minimum configurable period of 1 year to ensure auditability and meet compliance demands. The system must allow retention periods to be adjusted based on client policy and relevant regulatory requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: with retention configurable at a minimum of 1 year

title: Enable compliance/security roles to export access logs (CSV/JSON)
summary: Grant users with Compliance or Security roles the ability to export access logs in CSV or JSON format. This export functionality is restricted by role and supports compliance reviews and external reporting needs.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Enable users with 'Compliance' or 'Security' roles to export logs in CSV or JSON

title: Implement export filters: date, user, resource type
summary: Add export filtering criteria for access logs, allowing users to filter by date range, user, and resource type during export. These filters improve data manageability and facilitate targeted compliance or forensic queries.

title: Apply masking for sensitive data on export per policy
summary: Ensure that sensitive information in exported logs is masked according to defined policies. The export masking process enforces privacy protection and compliance requirements when data is shared or analyzed externally.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: masking sensitive info in exports as policy requires

title: Preserve original access context despite user role changes
summary: Ensure that historical access logs maintain the original access context, including user roles effective at the time of access, even if user roles have changed since. This maintains the integrity and accuracy of audit trails.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Maintain accurate historical access context even after role changes

title: Notify compliance leads of large exports/unusual access
summary: Set up automated notifications to compliance leads when there are large export actions or unusual access patterns. This promotes rapid response to potential security incidents and supports compliance oversight.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Notify compliance leads about high-volume exports or unusual patterns

title: Update admin documentation for export/retention processes
summary: Update administrative documentation and compliance playbooks to reflect new export and retention features. Comprehensive, current documentation is essential to ensure proper adoption and audit readiness.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Update admin documentation and compliance playbooks for the new features

title: Enforce rate-limiting on export actions
summary: Introduce rate-limiting controls for export actions to prevent system abuse and secure compliance logs. Restrictions mitigate the risk of data exfiltration or unintentional system overload.

title: Ensure geographic privacy/data-protection compliance
summary: Build and enforce mechanisms to ensure privacy, data protection, and geographic regulatory compliance for all processes relating to access logs. Implementation must respect jurisdiction-specific requirements for regulated industries.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: all processes must adhere to client-specific privacy, data protection, and geographic regulatory requirements
